intro: Mouroucoa panamensis, commonly known as the Panama mouroucoa, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Panama. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
